snippet: Some commuters on the 5:49 p.m. to White Plains had second thoughts about riding in the first car, which had been demolished in the previous night’s accident.
abstract: Some Metro-North commuters express second thoughts about sitting in first car of train following lethal crash near Valhalla, NY.

byline.contributor: Reporting on the Metro-North train crash was contributed by Lisa W. Foderaro, Winnie Hu, Thomas Kaplan, Corey Kilgannon, William K. Rashbaum, Marc Santora, Nate Schweber and John Surico, and research by Susan C. Beachy.

lead_paragraph: Some commuters on the 5:49 p.m. to White Plains had second thoughts about riding in the first car, which had been demolished in the previous night’s accident.

headline.main: On a Metro-North Train, Passengers Pause Before Picking a Seat
headline.print_headline: After Fatal Crash, Pausing Before Picking a Train Seat
